item.title: Verdansk Returning is The Right Call, But Call of Duty: Warzone Has to Tread Carefully
item.description:
Call of Duty: Warzone has been a successful entry in the battle royale genre. The long-running Call of Duty franchise is one of the leading titles in the first-person shooter world, and Warzone has brought an exciting free-to-play entry into the fold. Since the game's 2020 beginnings, there has been a series of fun maps featured, and one sorely missed location is finally making its way back into the game.

After rumors flooded the community since it got taken out of rotation, it has finally been confirmed that Verdansk is returning to Warzone . The Warzone map continues to be one of the most beloved maps by many players of the battle royale. Despite the map's popularity, Verdansk has been missing for quite some time, as it was discontinued in Warzone at the end of 2021. Relaunching sometime in 2025, Verdansk is an exciting return to form, but this also sets up Warzone for the tricky task of balancing both the old and the new in future updates.

Warzone Cannot Fully Rely on Nostalgia Moving Forward

Verdansk Could Kickstart a Problematic Trend

Throughout the Call of Duty franchise's long and varied history, compelling maps have played a large role in the success of its multiplayer gameplay. When it comes to Warzone , Verdansk is at the apex of fan-favorite maps, and the announcement of its return was a major highlight of the recent Call of Duty NEXT event. However, this could also run the risk of Warzone becoming trapped in the cycle of relaunching old maps in order to drum up excitement.

Verdansk returning to Warzone is definitely the right move, but it shouldn't stop the game from experimenting with new maps and locations. Warzone 's new Area 99 map is planned to launch next year as well, and it looks to be just as compelling as Verdansk, if not more. Inspired by another fan-favorite map, Nuketown, Area 99 aims to offer players something familiar while still experimenting and bringing a fresh map to the forefront. Bringing back strong maps like Verdansk makes sense, but it needs to be balanced with just as interesting new settings.

Verdansk is currently available in Warzone Mobile .

Warzone is no stranger to bringing back old maps. The return of Rebirth Island has also been a success, and it can easily be misconstrued that players only want old maps back. When Warzone first launched, Verdansk was the base map, which has filled it with plenty of nostalgia for players who jumped into the game back in 2020. Unfortunately, once the map was taken out of rotation, many follow-up maps in Warzone failed to reach the same heights as Verdansk. However, this doesn't mean solely returning to old maps is the key to future success.

Area 99 Alongside Verdansk Proves Balance is Possible for Warzone

Although Warzone hasn't always hit its target when it comes to new maps, Area 99 could begin a new era of fresh settings that offer just as much as older maps. The excitement behind Verdank's return doesn't need to be confused with a lack of interest in innovation. Some of the greatest changes to the Call of Duty franchise have been through taking chances. From the Zombies mode to introducing a free-to-play battle royale with Warzone , the series has often thrived when it experiments. Of course, not every new bit of exploration is going to be a hit, but it is worth trying for the sake of moving the series forward.

Continuing to rely on hyping up players by adding old maps into the rotation could get old very quickly. Warzone is promising some big changes ahead. Hopefully, that means blending fresh features with the nostalgic in order to craft a more balanced experience that helps Warzone evolve instead of staying in place.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Fans Should Circle September 29 On Their Calendars
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Final Fantasy 14 will host Letter From The Producer Live Part 83 at Tokyo Game Show 2024.
  • The broadcast, slated to air on September 29 at 1:50 AM Eastern, will cover Patch 7.1 and other miscellaneous news.
  • More highly anticipated features are on the way in future Dawntrail patches, including the addition of chat bubbles and a raid strategy planner.

Final Fantasy 14 is headed to the 2024 Tokyo Game Show, as Square Enix has confirmed that the MMORPG will be highlighted at the event later this month. During the festivities, Final Fantasy 14 will broadcast Part 83 of Letter From The Producer Live, with game producer and director Naoki Yoshida covering some details about the upcoming Patch 7.1 content update.

Final Fantasy 14 's next Live Letter broadcast will take place about three months after the Dawntrail expansion launch. Dawntrail was billed as the start of a new chapter in Final Fantasy 14 , though some overarching conflicts and ideologies remained prevalent throughout Patch 7.0. Both the different cultures and technologies of Tuliyollal and Alexandria were brought into conflict during the second half of the main story, and while most of these points of contention were resolved, some lingering questions about the state of Alexandria, in particular, remain.

While it remains to be seen how the Dawntrail 's full story will play out, players will soon have an idea of what to expect in the coming months. According to Square Enix, Part 83 of Letter From the Producer Live will be broadcast during the 2024 Tokyo Game Show on September 29 at 1:50 AM Eastern. The 90-minute presentation will be hosted by Naoki Yoshida and broadcast on Final Fantasy 14 's YouTube channel with Japanese and English text available. Aside from learning what the update's title will be, players can also expect to see details about the Futures Rewritten (Ultimate) raid, the Extreme version of the Interphos trial, and the opening act of the Echoes of Vana'diel alliance raid series that is part of a collaboration with Final Fantasy 11 .

Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.1 Will Be Discussed at Tokyo Game Show 2024

  • Final Fantasy 14 will host Letter From The Producer Live Part 83 on September 29.
  • Naoki Yoshida will host the presentation at the 2024 Tokyo Game Show in Chiba, Japan.
  • The Live Letter broadcast will start at 1:50 AM Eastern and will last approximately 90 minutes.
  • Live Letter Part 83 will cover part of Patch 7.1 and other miscellaneous game updates.

Final Fantasy 14 Patch 7.1 will bring Job balance updates to both PvE and PvP content, and will also offer various quality-of-life enhancements. During a PAX West Panel, a planned update to the Group Pose feature slated for Patch 7.1 will allow fishers to take a posed screenshot while their line is cast. Other features that are planned during the Dawntrail patch cycle include the addition of chat bubbles, a raid strategy planner, and a Portrait mode option for Group Poses.

Even though Final Fantasy 14 's current story is in its early stages, Yoshida said that Dawntrail will still have plenty of content for players to enjoy over the next few years. This upcoming Live Letter will be the first of two planned broadcasts that touch upon Patch 7.1 and other miscellaneous updates. Only time will tell how player feedback will shape the future of Dawntrail 's patch cycle.

item.title: Quidditch Champions: Achievement/Trophy Guide
item.description:
Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions is a game that features both offline play in the form of various Quidditch Cups, as well as PvP, where players switch between playing as a Chaser and one other role. There are 31 Achievements and 32 Trophies in Quidditch Champions , and most of them can be unlocked offline or online. However, to obtain them all, players will have to dip into both and try out different positions.

Thankfully, many of these accolades are achieved in the tutorial alone, where players learn the four roles at the Weasley's Burrow. Fans of the books and movies will also appreciate that many of the Achievements/Trophies are named after iconic and often funny Harry Potter quotes.

All Quidditch Champions Achievements/Trophies & How To Get Them

Name

Description

How To Unlock

Trophy Rarity

GamerScore Points

Look! Mum Made You a Sweater!

Customize a character in your roster

This is done during the tutorial or in the menus.

Bronze

10

Don't Go Making Friends with the Wrong Sort...

Win 5 Games of Quidditch While in a Party

Just one friend is needed and the games can be co-op vs AI.

Bronze

15

Bottle Fame

Complete a Career Challenge

These can be as simple as equipping a new emblem or changing a character's appearance.

Bronze

10

Brew Glory

Complete a Mastery Challenge for each role

These can be as simple as tackling 10 opponents as a Beater or completing 10 shovel passes as a Chaser.

Bronze

10

The Porskoff Ploy

Assist a goal by shovel-passing to a teammate shortly before they score

Use Left-Stick + Left-Bumper or Mouse + E to shovel pass as a Chaser.

Bronze

10

You'd Make a Fair Beater

Complete Beater Training

The third part of the tutorial.

Bronze

10

The Keeper, That's Me...

Complete Keeper Training

The second part of the tutorial.

Bronze

10

A Superb Keeper!

Save a goal with your Power Save

The second skill in the Attacking tree for Keepers allows players to save with a massive Power Kick that can stun enemies. Use this kick instead of catching the Quaffle.

Bronze

10

The Youngest Seeker in a Century

Complete Seeker Training

The fourth part of the tutorial.

Bronze

10

Roderick Plumpton's Protege

Catch a Snitch in less than 120 seconds

Upgrade a broom for more Speed and Agility, and unlock Seeker skill points. Avoid Bludgers and pass through rings for constant boost.

Bronze

10

It's Not Much, but it's Home!

Complete The Burrow Cup

Play the match at the end of the tutorial.

Bronze

10

Everyone Starts at the Beginning at Hogwarts

Win your first game

The lowest difficulty can be used.

Bronze

10

Hogwarts Hero

Win the Hogwarts Quidditch House Cup for the first time

There are three group-stage games, and then two bracket-stage games. These last two games must be won.

Bronze

10

Up!

Complete Chaser Training

The first part of the tutorial.

Bronze

10

Rough Game, Quidditch. Brutal!

Win a game of Quidditch without conceding any points.

Play defensively on the easiest difficulty and use the Beater to prevent the enemy Seeker from catching the Snitch.

Silver

40

Tutshill Tornado

Win 25 games of Quidditch

This works online and offline on any difficulty.

Silver

40

"E" for Exceeds Expectations

Reach level 45 in your Career

Earn Fame by playing games and completing some Challenges.

Silver

40

Brilliant, but Scary

Eliminate the opposing Beater without getting hit by a Bludger

Do this when they are focused on taking out your Seeker. Use tackles for extra damage.

Silver

40

Knock on Wood

Get an assist by stunning the enemy Keeper shortly before a goal

Camp near the Keeper or follow your Chasers on an attack.

Silver

40

Playcaller

Save a shot on goal from a Chaser you recently debuffed

The sixth skill in Teamwork for Keepers allows them to slow opponents with their Playcaller Rings

Silver

40

Constant Vigilance!

Catch a Snitch without getting hit by a Bludger

Perfectly time your dodges or get a friend to play Beater and take out the enemy Beater.

Silver

40

Mischief Managed

Stun a Player while they are highlighted for a score event

Wait with a summoned Bludger until they score.

Silver

40

Triwizard Titan

Win the Triwizard Quidditch Cup for the first time

Play the other two schools twice each to determine the top two, and then win the final.

Silver

40

World Cup Wonder

Win the World Cup for the first time

This tournament is unlocked after winning all previous ones. It is comprised of a group-stage and a bracket-stage.

Silver

40

I Want a Nice, Clean Game

Play 5 PVP Matches

You don't have to win, but don't leave part way through.

Silver

40

Chasers With Extra Responsibilities

Intercept a shot on your goals

Fly across your own hoops when the enemy is attacking.

Silver

40

Role-Star

Earn a Platinum medal for each role

Platinum medals are earned for extraordinary deeds within single Quidditch games.

Gold

75

Quidditch is Easy Enough to Understand

Win Any Cup on Champion difficulty

Unlock Champion difficulty by winning the World Cup. Then play the Triwizard Cup as it's easier to get into the final with only one team missing out.

Gold

75

I've Always Wanted to Use That Spell

Max out skill points in a single role

10 skill points is the max for each role and they are obtained by leveling up.

Gold

75

It's Not Any Broomstick, it's a Nimbus 2000

Upgrade a broom to max level

Brooms are upgraded with Moonstones which are obtained through leveling up, Challenges, and Season passes.

Gold

75

Quidditch Champion

Win 100 Games of Quidditch

Play on the easiest difficulty and reach 100 points ASAP by catching the Snitch as well as scoring goals.

Gold

75

Yer a Wizard, Harry!

Earn all Trophies

Play on the easiest difficulty for non-PvP Trophies.

Platinum

N/A

item.title: Destiny 2 Cheat Seller Has New Trial Request Denied
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • AimJunkies has been denied a new trial request against Bungie, after being ordered to pay the company $4.3 million.
  • Bungie is victorious in its legal battle against the cheat seller, and can now collect the arbitration award.
  • Bungie continues to fight against Destiny 2 cheaters while preparing new updates for the game.

Destiny 2 cheat seller AimJunkies has been denied a new trial request against Bungie, who originally filed a lawsuit against the group and its parent company Phoenix Digital in June 2021. This trial request came a year after AimJunkies was ordered to pay more than $4.3 million to Bungie for violating the company's DMCA and bypassing protection measures for Destiny 2 .

Bungie has an extensive history of legal battles against cheat groups and other malicious actors that sought to gain an unfair advantage against other players in Destiny 2 . One of the most recent and prolific cases involves AimJunkies, as Bungie is highly determined to prevent any cheat providers from ruining the in-game experience in the Crucible and competitive Trials of Osiris activity. Nearly two years after filing the initial complaint, the judge ruled in Bungie's favor in February 2023, determining that AimJunkies had violated the studio's DMCA and reverse engineered Destiny 2 to develop and sell its cheats. As a result, the judge ordered AimJunkies to pay the aforementioned $4.3 million sum to the studio to cover damages and Bungie's legal fees. The legal battle was not completely over for the cheat group, as AimJunkies filed two appeals against Bungie this year.

As reported by TorrentFreak, AimJunkies was denied a new trial request by the Seattle District Court, and the group will not proceed with either of its appeals against Destiny 2 developer Bungie. Firstly, the cheat group failed to convince the court to overturn the jury verdict issued back in May 2024. The Court of Appeals also affirmed the $4.3 million arbitration award to Bungie, with an additional $63,210 that must now be paid by Phoenix Digital and all individual defendants. The court noted that the scale of the award is "not completely irrational," and US District Judge Thomas Zilly ruled that Bungie had provided enough evidence to definitively prove that AimJunkies infringed on the company's copyrights.

Destiny 2 Cheat Seller AimJunkies Has Been Denied a Trial Request for Two of its Appeals

  • AimJunkies tried to appeal the court's decision in favor of Bungie and the $4.3 million arbitration award.
  • The group failed to convince the court to overturn the jury verdict and was denied a trial.
  • The arbitration award was affirmed, meaning Bungie can now collect it from AimJunkies.

Following the latest ruling, Bungie may now collect the arbitration award, since the appeal requests by AimJunkies have been denied. This appears to be a definitive win for the company as Bungie continues its long battle against Destiny 2 cheat makers that pose a threat against the security of the game.

While legal battles against cheaters continue, updates for Destiny 2 are still being prepared by Bungie. Destiny 2 Episode 1: Echoes Act 3 launched on August 27, serving as the concluding chapter of the Echoes storyline. Episode 2: Revenant is expected to launch this October with more new content, including story missions, legendary gear and weapons, and new Exotics.

item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Beat Cliff (September 2024)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Beat Cliff in Pokemon GO
  • Cliffs First Phase Counters
  • Cliffs Second Phase Counters
  • Cliffs Third Phase Counters

Pokemon GO Cliff's Shadow Pokemon lineup has changed for the month of September 2024. Cliff has multiple Shadow monsters, each with amazing battle abilities and prowess. You must have proper meta-knowledge and counter-selection to defeat the Team GO Rocket leader.

Pokemon GO Team GO Rocket's leaders are among the most powerful antagonists in the game. Regarding Cliffs battle roster, it comprises 7 Shadow Pokemon. Each of Cliff's Shadow Pokemon is extremely powerful and requires proper counters, but you must first find the leader to battle him. Win against several Team GO Rocket Grunts and collect 6 Mysterious Components to build a Rocket Radar , which can navigate you to Cliff . This guide details the Team GO Rocket leader Cliffs Shadow Pokemon for August 2024 and the best counters against them.

How to Beat Cliff in Pokemon GO

Cliff has a total of 7 Shadow Pokemon, and each of them is a capable fighter in Pokemon GO . The battle with Cliff has 3 rounds; the 1st round always starts with a single Pokemon . The 2nd and 3rd rounds are unpredictable ; the leader has 3 potential picks for each of these rounds . One requires extreme meta-knowledge and proper counters to win the battle.

Phase

Pokemon

First Phase

Shadow Lileep

Second Phase

  • Shadow Kingdra
  • Shadow Marowak
  • Shadow Aerodactyl

Third Phase

  • Shadow Tyranitar
  • Shadow Cradily
  • Shadow Dragonite

Cliffs First Phase Counters

Cliff always begins with Shadow Lileep for the battles first phase. It is a Rock and Grass-type Pokemon with boosted offensive prowess as a Shadow monster.

Shadow Lileep Counters

  • Type: Rock and Grass
  • Weakness: Bug, Fighting, Ice, and Steel-type moves
  • Resistance: Electric and Normal-type moves

Shadow Lileep Counter

Fast Move

Charged Move

Metal Claw (Steel-type)

Sunsteel Strike (Steel-type)

Metal Claw (Steel-type)

Sunsteel Strike (Steel-type)

Dialga

Metal Claw (Steel-type)

Iron Head (Steel-type)

Keldeo

Low Kick (Fighting-type)

Sacred Sword (Fighting-type)

Cobalion

Metal Claw (Steel-type)

Sacred Sword (Fighting-type) (Legacy)

Shadow Lileep Counter

Fast Move

Force Palm (Fighting-type)

Dragon Ascent (Flying-type)

Shadow Magnezone

Flash Cannon (Steel-type)

Cliffs Second Phase Counters

The battles second phase comes up with significant uncertainty. Cliffs Pokemon choice is not constant like in the first phase, so Pokemon GO trainers must prepare to battle against the likes of Shadow Kingdra, Shadow Gallade, and Shadow Aerodactyl. One must analyze the game's meta to counter these opponents effectively.

Shadow Kingdra Counters

  • Type: Water and Dragon
  • Weaknesses: Dragon and Fairy-type moves
  • Resistances: Fire, Water, and Steel-type moves

The third phase also proves to be a battle of prediction. Cliff has three choices he can pick for the final phase: Shadow Tyranitar, Shadow Cradily, or Shadow Dragonite. Pokemon GO trainers must carefully select counters that can go toe-to-toe with the Team GO Rocket leader's roster.
